books.title: Bees
books.author: Piotr Socha
books.description: One part science, one part cultural history, and countless parts fascination, Bees celebrates the important role that these intriguing insects have played in our ecosystem throughout the ages...
books.recommendation: Perfect for bedtime.

books.title: Trees
books.author: Piotr Socha, Wojciech Grajkowski
books.description: Part botany, part history, part cultural anthropology--Trees goes beyond the basics
books.recommendation: Perfect for bedtime.

books.title: Carl's Snowy Afternoon
books.author: Alexandra Day
books.description: Carl and Madeleine have plans of their own--they want to play in the snow
books.recommendation: Great for curious minds.
books.learnings: Exploring nature and the world around us.

books.title: Precious Moments: Little Book of Prayers
books.author: Jean Fischer
books.description: Inspire little ones to pray! This colorful board book teaches little ones, ages 2-4, prayers for thankfulness, praise, school, mealtime, and bedtime...
books.recommendation: Wonderful for classroom storytelling.

books.title: Monsters at Christmas
books.author: Zanna Davidson
books.description: It's nearly Christmas and Billy and Ruby are feeling VERY excited
books.recommendation: Perfect for bedtime.

books.title: One Little Raindrop: Life Cycles
books.author: Lesley Sims
books.description: One little raindrop falls from the sky.Follow its incredible journey until it finally reaches the sea, where it evaporates to become part of a cloud and begin the cycle all over again.
books.recommendation: Best read together with a parent.
books.learnings: Exploring nature and the world around us.

books.title: There’s a Bunny in Your Book
books.author: Tom Fletcher
books.description: It's a fluffy bunny, and she's VERY hungry, but those carrots are not for bunnies!
books.recommendation: Perfect for bedtime.

books.title: Frida the Rock-and-Roll Moth
books.author: Kim Hillyard , Kim Hillyard (Illustrator)
books.description: Frida is a musical moth who loves to rock out ­– but starts to doubt herself when others join in
books.recommendation: Great for curious minds.

books.title: Gretel the Wonder Mammoth
books.author: Kim Hillyard , Kim Hillyard (Illustrator)
books.description: Gretel the last mammoth feels overwhelmed in her new life;a story of asking for help.
books.recommendation: Wonderful for classroom storytelling.

books.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
books.author: Eric Carle
books.description: Suitable for children, this title covers colourful collage illustrations and its deceptively simply, hopeful story.
books.recommendation: Teach kids the cycle of life using nature references

books.title: Five-Minute Stories: Over 50 Tales and Fables
books.author: Cottage Door Press
books.description: Dive into the magical worlds of your most beloved fairytales and fables with this beautifully illustrated storytime treasury padded keepsake book both kiddos and their grown-ups will enjoy.
books.recommendation: A good read before each goodnight sleep

books.title: I Love You to the Moon And Back
books.author: Little Tiger Press, Tim Warnes
books.description: Big Bear loves Little Bear more and more as each day passes, right up to each new moon - and back. A joyful celebration of the love between parent and child, this lovely chunky board book is perfect for reading with your special little person.
books.recommendation: Loving your child every second of the day and sharing that
books.learnings: Recognize love and spread into the world.

books.title: The Lion Inside
books.author: Rachel Bright, Jim Field
books.description: A bestselling story about confidence, self-esteem, and a shy little mouse who sets out on a journey to find his roar.  In a dry dusty place where the sand sparkled gold, stood a mighty flat rock, all craggy and old. And under that rock in a tinyful house, lived the littlest, quietest, meekest brown mouse.
books.recommendation: A good read when starting mass kindergarden

books.title: Llama Llama Red Pajama
books.author: Anna Dewdney
books.description: Llama Llama's tale of nighttime drama has charmed readers as a classic hardcover for a full decade.
books.recommendation: Amazing to incporporate in your daily reading as to explain and exemplify the importance of routines for your child

books.title: Oh, The Places You'll Go!
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.description: In this classic Seussian tale, the good doctor primes his readers against all the little mishaps and misadventures that can befall even the best of us - from bang-ups and hang-ups to lurches and slumps - encouraging us to take life in our stride!
books.recommendation: An awesome ready to give courage and self esteem to your child
books.learnings: Teaching kids that sky is the limit as long as their heart is in everything they do.

books.title: You're My Little Blessing
books.author: Nicola Edwards
books.description: Celebrate God’s gift of your little one in this adorable rhyming and inspirational board book, full of sweet illustrations, shaped cut-outs, and raised elements!
books.recommendation: Perfect for cuddling up with your little one, these sweet rhyming stories celebrate a parent’s love for their child.
books.learnings: Celebrate your little blessing with this sweet and colorful rhyming board book all about the love a parent has for their precious gift from God

books.title: That's not my lamb...
books.author: Fiona Watt
books.description: Meet five adorable little lambs in this charming addition to the much-loved That's not my... series.
books.recommendation: A perfect first Easter gift for babies and toddlers.
books.learnings: Babies love the best-selling That's not my... books with their bold illustrations, patches to stroke, and a mouse to spot on every page, all designed to develop sensory and language awareness.

books.title: Little Blue Truck's Springtime: An Easter And Springtime Book For Kids
books.author: Alice Schertle
books.description: Beep! Beep! Little Blue Truck is out for a ride with his good friend Toad. The sun is shining and the flowers are blooming—it's a beautiful spring day! Who will they see along the way?
books.recommendation: Perfect for teaching young mind about how we all were littel first !
books.learnings: Open the flaps to meet all of the sweet baby animals just born on the farm. Peep! Peep!

books.title: Buffalo Fluffalo
books.author: Bess Kalb
books.description: Introducing a sweet and silly buffalo who tries to bluff and fluff his way into being bigger than he really is. This laugh-out-loud story by an Emmy-nominated comedy writer shows it’s okay to be yourself.
books.recommendation: Readers will find Buffalo Fluffalo’s insecurity endearing and will be moved to reassure him. This humorous and delightful book encourages self-acceptance with a lighthearted touch.
books.learnings: Centering on the unique lead character Huffalo Buffalo, who also happens to be very fluffy, this is a story that will inspire kids and grownups to accept who they are.

books.title: Will the Pigeon Graduate?
books.author: Mo Willems
books.description: Con-grad-ulations, Pigeon! He did it — or did he? Join our favorite winged friend in this hilarious journey where The Pigeon scrambles to get his degree — or get totally schooled.
books.recommendation: The Pigeon had better graduate! He did the work! He paid attention to the little details! He overcame some BIG obstacles! The Pigeon’s got this . . . Or does he?
books.learnings: Grab your caps, don your gowns, and raise your hands for The Pigeon’s biggest adventure yet

books.title: The Humble Pie
books.author: Jory John,
books.description: The Humble Pie likes to give others the spotlight. Aw, shucks!—they deserve it!  But when he’s paired with his best friend, Jake the Cake, for a school project, he soon realizes that staying in the shadows isn’t always as sweet as pie
books.recommendation: Readers of all ages will laugh along as their new pie pal discovers that letting your voice be heard always takes the cake!

books.title: A Wolf Called Fire: A Voice of the Wilderness Novel
books.author: Rosanne Parry
books.description: The stand-alone companion to Rosanne Parry’s New York Times bestseller A Wolf Called Wander tells the wilderness survival story of the wolf pup known as Warm and is illustrated in black and white throughout. This Voice of the Wilderness Novel features informational back matter, including a map.
books.recommendation: It’s inspired by Wolf 8, a real Yellowstone wolf who was the smallest of his pack and constantly bullied by his bigger brothers.
